abstract: We consider the problem of swimming at low Reynolds numbers. This is the relevant asymptotic for micro-and nano-robots needing to navigate in an aqueous medium. As a model, we propose a robot composed of three balls. The relative positions of these balls can change according to three degrees of freedom. We prove that this robot is able to navigate in a plane by modifying the conformation of its shape. Résumé. Nous considérons leprobì eme de la nagè a faible nombre de Reynolds.
